page.title: 09THATCHING AT THRESHERS FARM.
page.content: towards the ridge. The laid straw is held in place by strips of hazel-wood pegged by hazel staples 2 feet long,shaved in the middle , twisted & bent to a U-shape & thrust deep into the old thatch. The ridge capping & gable-top ornaments are added,pegged & trimmed; the eaves trimmed before new wire-mesh is secured over the entire thatch.Apprentice-ship used to be 9 years but is now reduced to 5. The straw is grown by the thatcher & harvested by the whole family & other helpers.Stacked under cover after reaping, the wheat is threshed as it is needed for thatching.
